title: PHPheader_remove()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPheader_remove()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Remove specific header:
<?php
header("Expires: Mon, 26 Jul 1997 05:00:00 GMT");
header("Cache-Control: no-cache");
header("Pragma: no-cache");
header_remove("Pragma");
?>
Definition and Usage
The header_remove() function removes an HTTP header 
header()
function.
Syntax
header_remove(
headername
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
headername
Optional. Specifies a header name to be removed. If omitted, all

Technical Details
Return Value:
Nothing
PHP Version:
5.3+
More Examples
Example
Remove all 
<?php
header("Expires: Mon, 26 Jul 1997 05:00:00 GMT");
header("Cache-Control: no-cache");
header("Pragma: no-cache");
header_remove();
?>

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPheader_remove()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPheader_remove()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPheader_remove()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
